newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank lowered its mini-band on the real currency by buying dollars at 1.0775 reais and selling at 1.0825 reais in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The previous mini-band was set on Monday at between 1.0765 and 1.0815 reais.
Today's auction was the first time this month the bank has nudged the mini-band lower, and represents a 0.09 percent decline from the previous mini-band.
In the last six months, the Central Bank has lowered the mini-band between 0.57 percent and 0.61 percent each month.
